Hi,How are you? Twitching and loss of control in your hand may indeed be attributed to neurological causes, such as injury or pressure to the nerve, postural, lack of blood supply, certain medications, electrolyte imbalance, and medical conditions such as diabetes or thyroid problems. If it persists, have this evaluated further by your doctor for proper diagnosis. Your medical history and complete neurological examination are important. Treatment usually depends on the underlying cause. Take care and do keep us posted.

You may have a compressed radial nerve. It happened to me by sleeping on my arm "wrong" somehow. I actually thought I had a mild stroke when I woke to my hand not working. I was sent to my Orthopedic Doc where the run some tests using electricity to manually make your fingers move.They will have you use this "TENS" device twice a day . And they want you to turn it up as far as you can stand it, The more electrical stimulation, the sooner You'll recover. Hope this Helps YaPeace / 57Cuznz
